title: How to find international clients for freelance writing - Quora

response.answer_text: The best way to approach them is through building a solid writing profile. You can use platforms like Medium to publish your writings and work. Next step will be to get on LinkedIN. Interact, comment and share other people’s post. Make meaningful relationships and keep pitching your services in between. For example: If you are publishing 7 pieces of contents on LinkedIn on daily basis, include 1 creative explaining what you do and how your work can improve their business. On LinkedIn itself, you can go to ‘Search’ and select the countries you want the clients from. LinkedIn based on your search query will generate the list of people or companies that are there on it platform. From that list shortlist clients you want to approach. Check how active they are on this platform. See what kind of posts they are putting out. Try and reach out to them, by commenting and sharing their posts. Once you establish a good relationship with them, pitch them the service you can offer them. A part from LinkedIn you can make your account on Fiverr and add on your pitch there. A well made pitch, using right keywords fetch good eyeballs on this network. All in all today, its all about establishing connections and making your networks strong. Content is the soul of any business so there are people who are looking for good content writers, all you need to do is, find and approach them. Good Luck!
